bannerDescription: Discover our ongoing research projects and explore our latest publications in Human-Computer Interaction and related fields.

projects.name: Deepfake Literacy
projects.description: Educating the public to recognize and respond to deepfake media.

projects.name: Enhancing adaptive user interfaces through realtime cognitive load detection
projects.description: This research explores how Adaptive User Interfaces (AUIs) can be improved by integrating real-time cognitive load assessment to optimize user experience, reduce mental effort, and boost interaction quality. It focuses on detecting users' mental workload and dynamically adjusting interface elements—like layout and navigation—non-intrusively, making systems more intuitive and user-centered.

projects.name: Explainable Abstractive Text Summarization Using Transformer and LSTM Architectures: A Comparative Study
projects.description: This research focuses on building and comparing Transformer-based and LSTM-based models for explainable abstractive text summarization. It aims to improve user trust and understanding by integrating explanation mechanisms into the summarization process, and evaluates how different model architectures and explanation formats affect performance and user comprehension.

projects.name: Designing a New AI-Integrated Development Methodology for Enhanced Efficiency
projects.description: This research introduces a new software development methodology that integrates AI agents across all phases—like planning, coding, testing, and maintenance—to improve team productivity, reduce delivery time, and enhance code quality. The framework is designed to be adaptable for different project types and team sizes, positioning AI as an active collaborator in modern development practices.
